title: Compliance Verification Engineer - Avionics (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

Here at Volocopter, we are the pioneers of electric air taxis (electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft - eVTOLs). We have pledged to bring sustainable urban air mobility to life by getting electric air taxis off the ground in a way that complements existing transportation options in megacities across the globe. In 2011 we carried out the first-ever crewed flight of a fully electric multicopter and have since conducted more than 2,000 public and private test flights across the world (www.volocopter.com).

Job Description

Your mission during this flight:

As a Compliance Verification Engineer Avionics, you will be part of the Office of Airworthiness, aligning the certification approach with EASA and verifying that the VoloCity Avionics design is meeting the requirements for certification.


 * You assistthe Avionics Engineering Team in design choices and test planning with a focus on potential certification risks
 * You prepare and conduct meetings with authorities to consent on the certification strategy and appropriate Means of Compliance
 * You drivethe Certification Program hands-on for Avionics aspects in close collaboration with Airworthiness Engineers and the Engineering Department
 * You report certification risks and potential mitigations in the respective field to the Head of Airworthiness
 * You formally verifycompliance in the field of the VoloCity Type Certification
 * You have appropriate, hands-on participation in rulemaking activities in the field of VTOL Avionics design
   
   

Qualifications

Check in your professional skills:


 * Master's Degree in aerospace engineering, electrical engineering, communications engineering or related field
 * Minimum 5 years of proven experience in aerospace development projects with involvement in certification activities, ideally already as a nominated CVE or equivalent such as DER
 * Detailed knowledge of certification processes (Part 21) and requirements under EASA (CS-23, CS-25, CS-27, CS-29, ideally also SC-VTOL)
 * Knowledge of certification deliverables according to DO-160, DO-178, and DO-254 in line with the ARP4754A framework
 * Ideally prior participation in standardization or rulemaking activities such as EUROCAE, ASTM, etc.
 * Excellent command of the English language
   
   

Additional Information

OurVolocopterflight includes:


 * Fast-growing high-tech company with a superb network of investors and partners 
 * Chance to shape the future of aviation
 * Help us to create groundbreaking new projects - from scratch! 
 * Personal accountability, as well as growth and learning opportunities, based on your personal strengths
 * An inspiring workplace with modern workspaces, flexible hours, quick decision-making, a flat hierarchy, positive leadership, great team spirit
 * Attractive compensation package
   
   

Diversity atVolocopter:

Our differences are what make us great.Here at Volocopter, we value equal opportunities and trust. As air mobility industry innovators, we believe that changing the world starts on team level.We are committed to fosteringanenvironment where everyone feels valued, respected, and empoweredtoreach their full potential.

title: Regulatory Affairs and QMS Lead
description:
Make a positive impact in the global healthcare community with cutting-edge medical mixed reality technology. 

About Us

apoQlar is the developer of a medical mixed reality platform that is revolutionizing how medicine is practiced, experienced, learned, and shared. Our flagship product, VSI HoloMedicine®, is a medically certified software platform that leverages the Microsoft HoloLens hardware to transform medical images, clinical workflows, and medical education into an interactive 3D mixed reality environment.

With offices in Miami, Poznan, Singapore and our headquarters in Hamburg we are dedicated to revolutionizing the healthcare industry by leveraging cutting-edge technology and innovative solutions.

We are currently looking for an enthusiastic and motivated individual to join our team in Hamburg (onsite/hybrid) to expand our Regulatory & Quality Management team. You will take a leading role within the Regulatory & Quality Management team and work closely with C-Level as well as our engineering teams to ensure our mixed reality platform is in compliance with regulatory and statutory requirements.

Responsibilities Include


 * Develop and lead the regulatory strategy to ensure compliance with applicable laws, regulations and ensure a fast and efficient certification of new product developments.
 * Maintain and optimize the current QMS and RA framework, focusing on specific processes such as change control, design controls, verification and validation, and risk management.
 * Lead the regulatory approval processes globally.
 * Lead the development of regulatory responses for questions from notified bodies, global regulators and regulatory representatives upon review of submissions in relation to the technical dossier.
 * Implement regulatory requirements in accordance with EU MDR 2017/745.
 * Lead risk management activities and work closely with the risk management team through the life cycle of medical device software.
 * Participate in and support external/internal audits and responses to audit findings as appropriate.
 * Ensure compliance with the current regulatory procedures and update the procedures when new regulatory requirements are determined.
 * Monitor the new/revised applicable regulatory requirements, standards, guidance, and common specifications.
 * Handle serious incident and adverse event reporting.
 * Ensure that the communication with Notified Bodies and Regulatory Authorities is effective and that all the required information is provided.
 * Ensure that marketing communication is according to regulatory requirements.
 * Ensure that regulatory and statutory requirements are fully met across the whole organization.
 * Ensure the promotion of awareness of applicable regulatory requirements throughout the organization.
 * Act as appointed Person Responsible for Regulatory Compliance (PRRC).
   
   

Qualifications


 * University degree in biomedical science, engineering, pharmacy, or any other applied natural sciences.
 * 7+ years of professional experience including MDD/MDR and FDA submissions.
 * Proficient practical FDA 510K application knowledge and a proven track record of associated products.
 * Proficient knowledge of EU medical device regulations and Quality Management Systems for medical devices.
 * Knowledge of MDSAP, ISO 13485, IEC 62304 and ISO 14971.
 * Experience in communication with authorities and notified bodies.
 * In-depth knowledge of Software Lifecycle Processes, including expertise in implementing the requirements of the IEC 62304 standard and AAMI TIR45 guidance (agile).
 * Extensive experience in Software as a Medical Device (SaMD), covering design controls, risk management, verification and validation, SOUP (Software of Unknown Provenance), and Software Configuration Management (SCM).
 * Demonstrated ability to maintain and streamline QMS for seamless use across the organization, ensuring a sustainable and compliant system.
 * Experience in communication with healthcare professionals.
 * Strong analytical skills to evaluate product compliance and interpret regulatory guidelines.
 * Ability to collaborate effectively with internal specialists and other external consultants (if required), ensuring alignment and cooperation.
 * Experience in external and internal Audits.
 * Fluency in English is a requirement, German is a huge plus.
   
   

Why Us?


 * Chance to work with new and exciting technologies.
 * Opportunity to positively impact the lives of patients, students, and surgeons around the world.
 * Chance to not just shape but also create an entirely new market in healthcare using medical mixed reality.
 * Work alongside a multicultural and international team – over 10 countries represented in our office.
 * A flat hierarchy with direct access to the founding team and C-Level.
 * High degree of ownership with the opportunity to drive projects forward on your own or with a team.
 * Competitive compensation structure and ability to grow quickly within an advancing team.
   
   

Are you interested in helping us shape an entirely new market in healthcare and advancing next generation medical technology? Then we look forward to hearing from you!

Location: Bremen, Germany

Field: Defence

About Us:

NAXCON GmbH, headquartered in Freiburg, is a leader in Germany's IT and engineering sectors. With expertise in software and hardware development, cutting-edge electronics, and future-focused technologies like AI and VR, we deliver innovative solutions to our clients. Alongside customer projects, we actively invest in in-house innovation and R&D. Trusted by renowned German companies, we pride ourselves on the expertise and dedication of our engineers.




Responsibilities:

 * Serve as the contact person for project and product teams regarding system/product safety and associated requirements and processes.
 * Conduct system analysis to identify hazards, risks, and implement suitable countermeasures.
 * Evaluate safety concepts and architectures in line with overall system requirements.
 * Derive safety requirements for hardware, software, and mechanics from customer needs and in-house analyses.
 * Prepare release-relevant documents and ensure compliance with processes required to achieve safety objectives.
 * Collaborate in planning and evaluating the verification and validation of products.
 * Create and maintain safety documentation throughout the development process.
 * Perform impact analyses for product changes or improvements.
 * Manage safety-relevant interfaces with internal and external stakeholders (customers, suppliers, auditors, and partners).
 * Advance in-house methods and processes for implementing safety standards in development projects.
 * Represent NAXCON in higher-level committees (e.g., CoC Safety, BAAINBw working groups).




Requirements:

 * A degree in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or Computer Science (Diploma/Master).
 * Minimum of 5 years of professional experience in product and system safety.
 * Broad experience in product safety, with strong knowledge in both product and functional safety.
 * Knowledge of functional safety standards, particularly ISO 26262 (essential, but not sufficient on its own).
 * Familiarity with key standards, including MIL-STD-882, ISO 12100, and IN 13849 (advantageous).
 * Experience in the defense sector is highly desirable.
 * Strong knowledge of product and system safety, particularly for vehicle-mounted systems such as missile platforms.
 * Experience working with interdisciplinary teams (20-25 people).
 * Business fluency in English and German (C1 level at minimum, as all documentation is in German).
 * Ability to derive concrete project requirements from norms and standards.
 * Experience moderating interdisciplinary teams.
 * Experience with SysML is helpful; project management skills are secondary.
 * Automotive background or experience in the automotive industry is also of interest.
 * Willingness to travel globally.
 * Willingness to relocate.







What We Offer:

 * Diverse Team: Work with an internationally mixed team that values diverse perspectives and talents.
 * Language Support: Improve your German language skills in a supportive environment.
 * Dedicated Contact Person: Benefit from a fixed company contact for guidance and support.
 * Professional Growth: Explore new industries or projects within 1-2 years, fostering active knowledge transfer.
 * Team Events: Enjoy regular company-organized events to build strong team relationships.
 * Competitive Compensation: Receive a salary commensurate with your expertise and experience.




Join Us:

Be part of a forward-thinking team where innovation meets excellence. Contribute your skills to shape the future of engineering in Germany.

Darüber hinaus unterstützt der CSV- & PVAL-Experte PDD- und Produktionsprojekte bei Bedarf.

a.) Computer System Validierungen (CSV)

 * Aufbau und Durchführung von Computer System Validierungen und Verifizierungen: Planung und Überwachung von Validierungs- und Verifizierungsaktivitäten und deren Durchführung, Koordination externer Stellen, Zusammenstellung und Analyse der Ergebnisse und Durchführung von Gegenmaßnahmen
 * Erstellung von Validierungs- und Verifizierungsplänen unter Berücksichtigung der Testentwicklung, Testressourcen, Testdurchführung, Standortwahl und Logistik im Zusammenhang mit externen und internen Validierungsmaßnahmen
 * Beteiligung an der Erstellung und/oder Überarbeitung von SOPs in der Funktion des Validierungsexperten, wie u.A. von Validierungsprozessen und -vorlagen
 * Bewertung von Problemen, Erstellung von Empfehlungen und Aktionsplänen für mögliche Korrekturmaßnahmen für die Aufsichtsbehörden

 * Vertretung/Anleitung des Projektteams bei der Verwaltung von Informationen von/zu anderen Abteilungen bezüglich der Validierung
 * Erstellen aller relevanten Dokumente im Falle einer Computer System Validierung
 * Unterstützung des Digitalisierungsprojekts der Computer System Validierung
 * Aufbereitung von Daten zur Kontrolle, welche Computer Systeme im Einsatz sind (Netzwerkscan)

b.) Prozessvalidierung (PVAL)

 * Aufbau und Durchführung von Prozessvalidierungen und -verifizierungen (DQ, IQ, OQ, PQ): Planung und Überwachung von Validierungs- und Verifizierungsaktivitäten und deren Durchführung, Koordination externer Stellen, Zusammenstellung und Analyse der Ergebnisse und Durchführung von Gegenmaßnahmen
 * Erstellung von Validierungs- und Verifizierungsplänen unter Berücksichtigung der Testentwicklung, Testressourcen, Testdurchführung, Standortwahl und Logistik im Zusammenhang mit externen und internen Validierungsmaßnahmen
 * Beteiligung an der Erstellung und/oder Überarbeitung von SOPs in der Funktion des Validierungsexperten, wie u.A. von Validierungsprozessen und -vorlagen
 * Bewertung von Problemen, Erstellung von Empfehlungen und Aktionsplänen für mögliche Korrekturmaßnahmen für die Aufsichtsbehörden
 * Ermittlung von Abweichungen und Lücken, sowie Planung und Durchführung von Validierungsaktivitäten gemäß den ermittelten Anforderungen - einschließlich der Notwendigkeit von Revalidierungsaktivitäten
 * Vertretung/Anleitung des Projektteams bei der Verwaltung von Informationen von/zu anderen Abteilungen bezüglich der Validierung
 * Erstellen aller relevanten Dokumente im Falle einer Prozessvalidierung
 * Unterstützung des Digitalisierungsprojekts der Prozessvalidierung




Ihr Profil




 * Hochschulabschluss in einem technischen Fachbereich, vorzugsweise Studienabsolvent mit technischem Hintergrund
 * Kenntnisse der CSV- und PV-Validierung in der Medizintechnik ist bevorzugt
 * Kenntnisse über Prozessvalidierungswerkzeuge wie z. B. Six-Sigma ist bevorzugt
 * Kenntnisse über verschiedene Softwaretypen wie z.B. SOUP und OTS Software ist bevorzugt
 * Strukturiertes Vorgehen bei der Arbeit und Durchführung von Projekten
 * Verständnis für Fristen und die Fähigkeit, unter Druck zu arbeiten
 * Gute statistische und mathematische Kenntnisse
 * Beherrschung von MS Office (Word, Excel, Project, usw.)

description:
Company Description

With 2.100 employees worldwide, the CS Group is a leading IT company in France and in Germany, and a prime contractor in designing, integrating and operating mission critical systems. It has now been over 30 years that comprehensive CS Group solutions for space systems and applications, both on the ground and in space, have been part and parcel of this odyssey.

Our German activities are growing at a fast pace and to face our customers' high level expectations and needs, we are looking for talented profiles with relevant experience in Space systems and applications.

Job Description

The activities performed by the key-person will be an input for the overall system and ground segment V&V activities. The key-person will typically be involved in tasks related to the EPS-SG or MTG V&V activities with focus on the Data Circulation test.

The following responsibilities are foreseen (not limited to):


 * Create and maintain the IV&V system data circulation test plan, test specification and test procedures, test tools and test data.
 * Coordinate and supervise the execution of the system data circulation tests (this includes coordination with external entities (ie. partners and industry)
 * For all relevant test activities consolidate the test results, generate test reports and perform the necessary analysis.
 * Identification of the suite of test tools and test data required to support V&V activities.

 * Contribution to the preparation and execution of V&V tests of end-to-end processing chains, such as preparation of test specifications and procedures, test tools and test data.
 * Development of test tool and test data.

 * University degree in the domain of engineering, physics or equivalent.

 * Experience with software specification, design and development and relevant standards.
 * System requirements management and functional/architectural modelling, with support of tools (e.g. DOORS).
 * Configuration Control processes and tools.
 * Good skills in Python.

Additional skills and experience (considering as an added value) :

 * Be able to plan his/her work and to cope with tight schedules and multiple tasks;
 * Ability to write accurate and consistent technical documentation;
   
   

Additional Information

Possible starting date: As soon as possible

title: Manager (m/f/d) Warehouse & Network designing
description:
METRO is a leading international wholesale company with food and non-food assortments that specializes in serving the needs of hotels, restaurants and caterers (HoReCa) as well as independent traders. Around the world, METRO has some 16 million customers who can choose whether to shop in one of the large-format stores, order online and collect their purchases at the store or have them delivered. METRO also supports the competitiveness of entrepreneurs and independent businesses with digital solutions and thereby contributes to cultural diversity in retail and hospitality.



The purpose of the role is to facilitate the implementation of METRO’s Multichannel Network Transformation on a global scale and manage the process of the evolution of METROs multichannel network assets, including design, approval, and execution, across Corporate and Country stakeholders and towards the strategic objectives as defined by the Group Strategy.





Job Description


 * Provide accurate and continuously up-to-date information at any time on METRO’s global network plan at global, country, and single location level on current status, and asset transformation investment proposals, approvals and implementation (historic, currently pending and planned in the future)
 * Ensure build-to-suit of network transformation projects during design phase optimizing sizing and infrastructure in-line with capacity needs
 * Implement standard capacity calculation approach (ADT tool) across countries and projects and continuously improve and enrich simulation model based on implemented sites and real-life feedback
 * Review network nodes’ performance and capacity utilization after go-live, identify best practices and share with global network transformation community
 * Determine and track saturation levels of global multichannel network, anticipating potential bottlenecks and avoiding capacity constraints potentially limiting targeted FSD growth ambitions
 * Design and continuously enhance technological tools for network design as well as the associated elaboration of scenario analyses, capacity parametrization and operational process modeling (including eg. WMS systems, warehouse automation opportunities, etc.)
 * Support and safeguard the countries in the execution of the Network Transformation and ensure the training of the relevant key stakeholders in the country
 * Define and algin KPI’s along the network evolution path to specifically trigger the right changes to the network at the right time considering Service Level, CAPEX and OPEX requirements
 * Ensure multilateral stakeholder management, as the implications of this role are broad so are the stakeholders that are involved
   
   

Qualifications


 * University degree in supply chain management or economics or engineering
 * Broad understanding of FMCG wholesale business requirements and dynamics, specifically supply chain- and fulfillment operations while and understanding of store operations can beneficial
 * Solid experience in warehouse design, calculation and optimization. Relevant experience in a consultancy environment can be a plus
 * Experience as project manager or process manager will be an advantage
 * Reliable and responsible way of working in a multicultural setting
 * Strategic conceptual skills, able to manage complexity and strive for simplification
 * Analytical and problem-solving oriented thinking
 * Fluent in English (spoken and written); third language welcome
   
   

Additional Information



What we offer:



 * Work-life balance: trust-based working hours, 30 days' holiday, and up to 3 days home office per week
 * Training: a comprehensive training offer via our own training center or externally, as well as your own annual training budget.
 * Well-being: health programs, free gym on our campus, regular employee events.
 * Comfort: very good transport connections and free parking spaces including charging facilities for e-mobility. Canteen with very reasonably priced meals as well as discounts in our stores and at many partner companies.
 * Company pension plan: you will receive an allowance from us to provide for your pension.

title: Product Owner Data (m/w/d)
description:
DEINE BRILLANTE ZUKUNFT IN DER TECH-WELT ERWARTET DICH

Willkommen in der Welt von Zoi. Wir gestalten die digitale Evolution unserer Unternehmenskunden und schließen die Lücke zwischen Unternehmens-IT und neuen Technologien. Zoi ist bestrebt, die Cloud in die Retail und Manufacturing-Industrie zu bringen - mit innovativen Lösungen, die echten Mehrwert bieten.

Wir erweitern unser europäisches Team in Stuttgart und Berlin. Das Reisen zwischen unseren Standorten ist möglich.

DEINE AUFGABEN – Das machst Du bei uns:


 * Kundenzentriert: Du gestaltest und begleitest herausfordernde Data-Enterprise-Projekte, und sorgst dafür, dass unsere Kunden das volle Potenzial ihrer Daten ausschöpfen können, um ihr Business voranzutreiben.
 * Als Impulsgeber:in und aktives Teammitglied bereicherst Du das Data Team bei bestehende Themen- und Aufgabenfelder und hilfst neue Perspektiven einzunehmen.
 * Du bringst Struktur in komplexe Zusammenhänge und Vorgänge unserer Datenprojekte, erarbeitest die Priorisierungen und stellst die Priorisierungsentscheidungen dar.
 * Du bist dabei das verbindende Element zwischen den Geschäftsprozessen, den Datenflüssen und dem Datenmodell und der Technologie.
 * Klare Sache: Deine Arbeitsergebnisse bereitest Du verständlich, strukturiert und zuverlässig auf und wendest Techniken des zielgruppengerechten Storytellings in Deiner Kommunikation an.
 * Du betreibst aktives Stakeholder-Management und kommunizierst fortlaufend, sowohl mit unseren Kunden als auch mit dem internen Team und bist daher das entscheidende Bindeglied zwischen Business, Methodik und Technologie.
   
   
   

DEIN BACKGROUND – Das bringst Du mit


 * Dein (Master-)Studium in einem der MINT-Fächer, hast du erfolgreich abgeschlossen - gerne auch als Quereinsteiger:in mit Promotion.
 * Du hast erste Projekte im Daten- oder Analytics-Bereich geleitet und hast idealerweise bereits erfolgreich in mehreren Data-Enterprise-Projekten mit Methoden agiler Arbeitsweisen wie z.B. Scrum und Kanban gearbeitet.
 * Durch Deine Data Kenntnisse sind Programmiersprachen, Datenarchitekturen, Machine Learning, etc. Teil Deiner Expertise.
 * Du bist ein Teamplayer und bereit, täglich mit den unterschiedlichsten Menschen im Unternehmen zu interagieren, Du handelst mit einem hohen Maß an Eigenverantwortung und behältst einen kühlen Kopf, selbst wenn die Dinge verrückt laufen.
 * Arbeitspraxis: Du arbeitest analytisch und strukturiert. Agiles Arbeiten ist für Dich selbstverständlich, Du bist es gewohnt, remote mit internationalen Teams zu arbeiten und Workshops bzw. Meetings durchzuführen.
 * Mit Deiner Empathie, Kommunikationsstärke, Souveränität und Klarheit hilfst Du uns, Team Zoi noch besser zu machen.
 * Du verfügst über sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift.
   
   
   

Du bist gerne von brillanten Köpfen umgeben? Fantastisch. Bei Zoi wirst Du Teil unserer Community von Tech-Enthusiasten und kannst Dein volles Potenzial entfalten. Kreiere frische Ideen und gestalte die digitale Transformation unserer Unternehmenskunden nachhaltig mit.


 * GUTE ARBEIT SOLL BELOHNT WERDEN, deshalb bieten wir verschiedene Bonusmodelle an
 * TIME IS WISDOM, 20 % Deiner Arbeitszeit stehen Dir für Experimente und Weiterbildung zur Verfügung
 * SKILL YOURSELF UP, Zoi kann nur so gut sein, wie Du es bist. Deshalb legen wir Wert auf ständige Weiterbildung und Entwicklung
 * BE FREE, dank unserer absolut flexiblen Arbeitszeiten und Remotearbeit von all unseren Standorten aus
 * DEVELOP YOURSELF mit unserem individuellen Zertifizierungs- und Schulungsplan
 * FAMILY COMES FIRST, deshalb unterstützen wir Dich finanziell bei der Kinderbetreuung
 * REFUEL tanke neue Kraft bei unserem regelmäßigen kostenlosen Mittagessen am Freitag
   
   
   

Zoi ist ein Arbeitgeber, der die Chancengleichheit fördert und sich dafür einsetzt, dass du deine beste Arbeit leisten kannst. Wir versprechen, uns für Vielfalt einzusetzen, eine integrative Kultur aufzubauen und unseren Teil für eine gleichberechtigte Arbeitswelt zu leisten.

title: Projektleiter / Product Owner
description:
Wir sind jung und kreativ, wir schätzen Vielfalt und Meinungsfreiheit - das hast du wahrscheinlich schon von jeder einzelnen Berliner Digitalagentur gehört. Was uns jedoch unterscheidet, ist die Art und Weise, wie wir miteinander und mit unseren Partnern zusammenarbeiten. Da wir unseren Kunden Full-Cycle-Digitaldienste (von Beratung/Forschung, UX/UI Design, Entwicklung bis hin zu Produktverantwortung) anbieten, gehen wir jede Aufgabe als unser eigenes internes Projekt an.




Du kannst dich darauf einstellen, in eine Vielzahl von Branchen einzutauchen - unser Kundenspektrum reicht von aufstrebenden Berliner Fashion-Startups bis hin zu großen Industrieunternehmen. Dies ermöglicht es uns, dir eine große Vielfalt an Projekten anzubieten, die zu deinen Fähigkeiten und Ambitionen passen.




Wir sind der Ort, an dem Familie auf Party trifft, an dem freier Geist auf strukturierten Ansatz trifft, an dem Erfahrung auf Neugier trifft. Während wir hart daran arbeiten, unsere Ziele zu erreichen, denken wir immer noch, dass es Raum für Spaß und ein gutes Lachen gibt.







Die Aufgaben

Du wärst vollkommen zuständig für die von dir betreuten Projekte. Das heißt:




 * Verstehen, wie das Endergebnis zum Geschäftswert des Kunden beiträgt und führen des Projekts durch Design- und Entwicklungsphasen
 * Agieren als vertrauenswürdiger Berater unserer Kunden, welcher zum einen Lösungen für scheinbar aussichtslose Probleme anbietet und zum anderen aber den Kunden, wenn nötig, auch auf die vereinbarten Projektrichtlinien hinweist. Durchführen der Project-Discovery-Phase, in welcher die Techniken des Requirement Engineering angewendet werden, um den Kunden zu helfen, dessen Ideen zu spezifische User Stories und Systemanforderungen zu kristallisieren.
 * Projekte aus anfänglich unklaren Zuständen herausführen, indem klare Fahrpläne mit Meilensteinen, Fristen und Qualitätszielen festgelegt werden.
 * Nichts ist zu klein, um es nicht zu spezifizieren: Schreiben und organisieren von festen Aufgaben oder Tickets, die für Entwickler, Designer und Copywriter umsetzbar sind. Gründliches Testen von Funktionen in verschiedenen Browsern und auf verschiedenen Geräten. Erstellen von detaillierten Dokumentationen für nicht-technische Benutzer.
 * Volle Verantwortung für das gesamte Finanzmanagement von Projekten, einschließlich der Erstellung genauer Finanzberichte.







Must-Haves:




 * Abgeschlossenes Studium in den Bereichen Wirtschaftsinformatik, Betriebswirtschaft oder gleichwertige Erfahrung.
 * 2 Jahre Erfahrung in der erfolgreichen Durchführung komplexer IT-Projekte und der Leitung von Projektteams.
 * Hohe Affinität zu digitalen Lösungen und Design, die es dir ermöglichen, in User Journeys, Systemanforderungen und Datenflüssen zu denken.
 * Nachgewiesene Fähigkeit, Risiken zu erkennen, bevor sie auftreten, und dementsprechend Strategien zur Risikominderung und -vermeidung im Rahmen der Softwareentwicklung zu entwickeln.
 * Das Organisieren von Aufgaben, Zeitplänen und Abläufen bereitet dir große Freude.
 * Hervorragende mündliche und schriftliche Kommunikation in Deutsch und Englisch, einschließlich einer starken Präsenz gegenüber Executive Stakeholdern.




Noch ein paar Nice-to-Have's:




 * SCRUM-Zertifizierung (PSPO oder PSM) und Kenntnisse in agilen und klassischen PM-Methoden.
 * Fähigkeit, Kunden bei der Nutzung von E-Commerce-Plattformen und Content Management Systemen (z.B. Wordpress oder Shopify) zu beraten und zu schulen.
 * Erfahrung mit Conversion Rate Optimization, Analytics und Digitalem Marketing.
 * Grundlegendes Verständnis von REST APIs, Source Control Systemen (Git), HTML und CSS.







Und natürlich – Benefits




 * Büro in der BackFabrik.
 * Home Office: Wir sind ein Team und legen Wert auf den persönlichen Kontakt. Daher erwarten wir, dass unser Team etwa 2-3 Tage pro Woche in unser Büro kommt. Für den Fall, dass du jeden Tag kommen möchtest, steht dir dein eigener Arbeitsplatz zur Verfügung. Gelegentliche Workations sind natürlich auch möglich!
 * Sportclub-Mitgliedschaft mit Teilabdeckung
 * Bezuschusstes BVG-Jobticket
 * Betriebliche Altersvorsorge
 * Betriebliches Fahrradprogramm




Das Übliche




 * Neues MacBook Pro M2 und 4k-Doppelbildschirm-Setup (für Büroarbeit)
 * Firmentag und Party einmal im Quartal
 * Snacks, Obst, Kaffee, Tee – das Übliche
 * Team-Lunch einmal pro Woche







Job Practical Details




Gehalt: bis zu 82.500 €

Verbindlichkeit: Vollzeit

Urlaub: 27 Tage pro Jahre




Wenn du dich für diese Stell interessierst, dann bewirb dich und lass und einander kennenlernen.




Der allgemeine Interviewprozess besteht aus: kurzer Vibe-Check und einem Case Study Interview.




Wir freuen uns darauf, dich kennenzulernen!




--

Bitte beachte, dass wir die Zeit und Mühe, welche du in deine Bewerbung an uns investiert hast, zwar zu schätzen wissen, allerdings können wir aufgrund der Vielzahl an Bewerbungen nur den in die engere Auswahl gekommenen Bewerbern eine Rückmeldung geben. Wenn du innerhalb von 21 Tagen nichts von uns hörst, geh bitte davon aus, dass deine Bewerbung in diesem Fall nicht erfolgreich war. Wir bedanken uns für dein Verständnis.

description:
At the headquarters in Ottobrunn near Munich, the Porsche eBike Performance GmbH develops, produces and markets advanced drive systems for two brands: FAZUA with the focus on pioneering compact lightweights for agile e-bikes and under the brand name Porsche exceptionally powerful drive systems. FAZUA is a young, ambitious brand that has transformed the cycling industry in 2017 with its innovative drive system for agile, compact, lightweight (and extremely good looking) e-bikes. Since July 2022, we are a part of the Porsche eBike Performance GmbH through the takeover by Porsche AG. Our diverse, open-minded, ambitious (and fun) team is constantly seeking new, inspiring talents who will help us push boundaries to shape the future of e-bike technology.

Aufgaben


 * Requirement Gathering: Collaborate with stakeholders, including product managers, development and test teams, to elicit and document technical requirements and specifications. Driving technical requirements generation from business and product requirements
 * Classic System Requirements Analysis: Perform system requirements analysis based on stakeholder requirements and in coordination with system and software architects
 * Documentation: Document requirements at the system level and support departments in creating domain-specific requirements. Create comprehensive and detailed requirement documents, including specifications, use cases, and process flows
 * Communication: Serve as a liaison between stakeholders and development teams, ensuring clear and continuous communication throughout the project lifecycle
 * Coordination and Support: Organize and coordinate requirements reviews. Provide support in planning and estimating work packages concerning time and resource requirements for requirements engineering.
 * Requirements Baselines: Implement and manage requirements baselines
 * Quality Assurance: Work with Test and QA teams to ensure that requirements are testable and that testing plans align with requirement specifications
 * Stakeholder Management: Build and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders to understand their needs and expectations. Facilitate meetings and workshops to gather feedback and discuss requirements.
 * Project Support: Provide ongoing support to project teams by ensuring clear requirements, assisting in troubleshooting issues, and ensuring that requirements are met.
 * Reporting: Regularly report on the progress of the processing in the project based on KPIs yet to be defined
 * Best Practices: Stay updated on industry best practices and methodologies related to requirements management and apply them to improve processes. Support the development and design of the requirements engineering process
 * Process Identification: Identify and introduce necessary requirements management processes, tools, and development methods for R&D departments
 * Project-Specific Requirements Engineering: Take responsibility for project-specific requirements engineering in development projects
 * Technical Changes: Coordinate and manage technical changes
 * Infrastructure Creation: Create tool-based and project-specific infrastructure
   
   

Profil


 * Bachelor's degree or higher education in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
 * Minimum of 5 years of experience in Systems Engineering, Requirements Management or similar position
 * Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
 * Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
 * Experience with best practices for writing requirements (INOSE, EARS, etc.)
 * Proficiency in requirements management tools (DOORS, Jama, etc.)
 * Experience with process assessment and lifecycle standards (ISO 33004, ISO 12207, ISO 15288, ASPICE, etc.)
 * Experience with Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) and V-model processes.
 * Ability to manage multiple priorities for multiple projects simultaneously.
 * Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work well with cross-functional teams.
 * Detail-oriented with a strong focus on quality and accuracy.
 * Bonus points:
    * Experience with e-bike or automotive industry projects.
    * Familiarity with agile methodologies and tools.
    * Certified in requirements management or business analysis (CBAP, PMI-PBA, etc.).
    * Experience with Model Based System Engineering Requirements Generation.
    * German language skills are an advantage.
      

Wir bieten


 * We are a diverse and international team of creative minds, passionate bike nerds, and progressive thinkers
 * You will see your ideas taking shape quickly: bring in your thoughts, challenge the status quo and see innovations being implemented soon
 * We offer a hybrid working model depending on the position.

 * Our location in the jaw-dropping Bavarian landscape offers a fantastic surrounding for rides. Take the chance to lease your dream bike on JobRad or simply grab one of our test bikes if available
 * We try to live sustainability in everything we do – instead of just talking about it
 * We are supportive of further education and foster ambitions of growth within the company

At Futurail, we're revolutionizing the rail industry by developing autonomous train technology. We're a passionate and experienced team of engineers and business experts who are driven to make a positive impact on the future of rail transportation.




Job Description:

As a Safety Engineering Lead based in our Munich, Lyon or Strasbourg office, you will be responsible for developing the safety case for our autonomous train technology, including safe obstacle detection. With no existing commercial rail-certified obstacle detection systems in the market, you must tackle this challenge with a highly creative and forward-thinking mindset. This role requires you to revisit the core principles of safety, extract valuable insights from other industries, and seamlessly integrate them while navigating the unique constraints of the rail environment.

 * Implement processes, methods and tools needed to develop SIL 2 software
 * Write a railway safety file that will be accepted by Independent Safety Assessors and approval bodies like ERA, EPSF, EBA, and others
 * Promote a safety culture to all parts of our company




Requirements:

 * A minimum of 5 years of proven work experience with safety
 * Successful completion of homologation process of a commercial product
 * Understanding of different perception sensors such as LiDAR, camera, and radar, along with knowledge of computer specifications
 * Good communication skills to explain the argumentation of the safety case to assessors
 * Experience in the rail environment and with CENELEC norms is a big plus
 * Fluent in English and at least one of French or German
 * Openness to learn, pragmatism, ambition and fun to work with




Why Join Us:

At Futurail, we offer a dynamic and supportive work environment where you'll have the opportunity to make a real difference. You'll be surrounded by talented colleagues who are passionate about their work. We also offer competitive salaries and stock options.

description:

CGI is a European leader in Space Ground Segment systems and services in the domains of Earth Observation, Navigation, Satellite Communications, Space Safety and Mission Operations. We provide critical services and solutions to European & national agencies and institutions, the scientific community, the commercial sector, as well as to the wider public. The European Space market is dynamic, evolving and rapidly growing. CGI is now looking to further expand our business in this area, building on our more than 40-year successful heritage. We are therefore seeking a Project Manager (m/f/d) to support this growth.

As a Project Manager (m/f/d) you will get insights into our activities within our ground segment services, infrastructure and software business, working directly together with our clients in the Space domain. You will have end-to-end responsibility of one or more of our projects, both towards the client and towards our internal organization. You will be responsible for managing the project’s client, the project team and you will ensure that the project schedule is executed in-line with everybody’s expectations, considering scope, cost, and time. risk, change, supplier and procurement management will be as important as managing the quality within the project. Outstanding communication skills in front of the various stakeholders will be of great importance. Besides the usual controlling activities on your project(s), monitoring and reporting progress towards the client and CGI’s internal management is key for the role.

Aufgaben

As a Project Manager (m/f/d) you:


 * will ensure that the project deliverables are provided in time, in cost and in-line with the quality expectations.
 * develop and manage an integrated project plan with realistic and effective schedules, financial budgets, resources, and risk mitigations, to meet milestones and contractual obligations.
 * will engage with your clients, identifying needs and opportunities and leading change.
 * act as a servant project leader who leads through context, empowerment, and enabling of your project team.
 * will identify and manage project risks and opportunities.
 * will effectively manage stakeholder relationships with our customers and partners.
 * support negotiation of contract changes
 * lead communication and reporting with customers and suppliers.
 * ensure scope, change, and claim management throughout the project lifecycle.
 * are accountable for planning and execution of projects with multi-disciplined teams (engineering, testing, quality, accounting) ranging in size and complexity.
 * document and communicate project progress and status to all stakeholders.
   
   

You will receive extensive support and training to equip you with the CGI tools for project managers.

Qualifikation


 * Proven record of 5+ years having managed end-to-end IT, infrastructure and software projects, ideally in the space domain.
 * Ability to work closely with technical teams to understand and grasp concepts and issues and translate those to schedule and cost impacts with a balanced approach to risk.
 * Proven experience of implementing and managing project contracts.
 * Experience in a variety of project management frameworks including Agile.
 * Project Management Certification through PMI, IPMA or similar.
 * Knowledge of space mission systems engineering (e.g. ECSS) or MBSE is a big plus.
 * Experience in leading and managing diverse multidisciplinary engineering teams.
 * Excellent communication, leadership and negotiation skills.
 * Networked thinking, planning skills, assertiveness, and high resilience as well as a curious and open mindset.
 * Proven ability to deliver solutions under pressure and to tight timescales.
 * Technical affinity is a plus.
 * Fluency in spoken and written German & English.
   
   

What We Offer

CGI offers our employees an exciting and flexible work environment in which to build their careers. This is especially reflected within our Space business which offers a corporate culture built around diverse teams, international collaboration, flat hierarchies and open communication.

CGI’s values emphasise our commitment to work in partnership with our clients by providing objectivity and integrity in all of our undertakings, whilst also delivering quality solutions and services. We also place a strong focus on Corporate Social Responsibility, encouraging and supporting our employees in the continuous improvement of the economic, social and environmental well-being of the communities in which they live and work. This is further reflected in the company’s commitment to be carbon neutral by 2030.

Consistent with our dream of creating an environment in which we enjoy working together, CGI is committed to fostering and maintaining professional workplaces that respect the dignity of all members. CGI is unconditionally inclusive and we are constantly evolving and creating new network that support and promote the richness of our diversity, equity and inclusion across our organization.

In addition to the above, CGI offers the following:


 * At CGI, we view our professionals as company owners. A set percentage of your salary can be invested in CGI shares, and CGI matches your contribution, up to a set maximum.
 * Flexible working hours and conditions to optimise your work/life balance (35h-40h/week), 30 days of holidays, numerous special leave days (e.g. wedding, birth, relocation, etc.)
 * In addition, sabbatical or parental leave is supported.
 * Company car & bicycle leasing schemes
 * JobTicket for public transport throughout Hessen, for both business and personal use

 * Corporate benefits providing attractive CGI employee discounts from well-known brands and providers.
 * A strong focus on continued learning and development
 * An exciting, challenging and diverse environment where you can grow your career as part of a great team
 * A great corporate culture built around international collaboration, flat hierarchies and open communication
 * A company committed to be carbon neutral by 2030 with a strong focus on Corporate Social Responsibility – contributing to the communities we live in.
   
   

Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.

As a Process Expert - System Engineering (m/f/d), your role will be to develop and enhance processes and methods for aircraft development, particularly in systems engineering. You will analyze complex technical data to identify areas for improvement and provide strategic recommendations to senior management. Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including the design, production, and testing teams, will be key to ensuring the seamless integration of systems engineering into the overall development process. Additionally, the candidate will be responsible for maintaining best practices for tool selection and implementation and staying up to date with industry trends and advancements.

Some of your regular tasks will include:


 * Lead the development and improvement of new methods and processes for aircraft development, with a focus on systems engineering and in accordance with aerospace standards, internally referred to as the Business Architect.
 * Collaborate with internal/external stakeholders and management to develop sensible & pragmatic solutions for process development and improvement.
 * Guide and support the Head of Department and/or Chief Engineering (CE) in process activities and prepare decisions for the CE and/or management.
 * Ensure consistency and completeness of systems engineering processes across departments and organization; analyze the impact of process decisions
 * Develop training for engineers on processes and tools related to systems engineering and method development.

 * Communicate and negotiate with software suppliers on license usage and administration topics.

 * A minimum of 8+ years of relevant experience in Aerospace & Systems Engineering
 * Solid experience with Requirements Based Engineering (RBE)
 * Proven experience in full lifecycle of a certified aircraft development program
 * Experience in different design cycles
 * Demonstrated knowledge of aviation regulations and standards such as ARP4754A, ARP4761
 * Formal training regarding system engineering is a strong plus (e.g., INCOSE)

description:
Our client FLIR designs, develops, manufactures, markets, and distributes technologies that enhance perception and awareness. FLIR brings innovative sensing solutions into daily life through thermal imaging, visible-light imaging, video analytics, measurement and diagnostic, and advanced threat detection systems. FLIR offers a diversified portfolio that serves a number of applications in government & defense, industrial, and commercial markets. Today the company is part of Teledyne Technologies Inc. (NYSE:TDY) world leader in enabling technologies to sense, transmit and analyze information for industrial growth markets, employing worldwide around 11.000 employees.

FLIR Integrated Solutions offers integrated end-to-end security and traffic safety (visual and thermal) camera systems. Traffic managers use intelligent technology from FLIR to monitor and manage traffic streams. Be it for monitoring motorists and pedestrians in urban areas, for detecting incidents on highways and in tunnels, or for traffic data collection, FLIR’s intelligent Video Detection and Monitoring Solutions enhance traffic safety and mobility on a daily basis. FLIR thermal cameras are the industry standard for 24/7 perimeter monitoring. In addition to thermal, FLIR is known for its first-class radars, visible cameras, video management systems, and command and control software for security applications.




To further strengthen the international team of Project Engineers in the Technical Support group, FLIR has an exciting career opportunity available for a talented and experienced :




Project Support Engineer - Central & Eastern Europe

Traffic Safety, Critical & Smart City Infrastructure




Mission




• After a training and introduction period you will be performing on-site pre- & post-sales technical support activities for diverse high-technological and intelligent traffic & transportation projects. • As the main technical contact point and interface for system integrators and end-customers you will assist with installation and commissioning of systems and equipment and you will ensure efficiënt and high-quality troubleshooting, acceptance testing, training and service to clients, both on-site and via remote connection. • As part of the pre-sales support you will study the project camera and network design in order to propose improvements or alternative solutions. You will work closely together with the Sales team by responding to technical requests from existing and prospective customers. • In the course of the project management cycle you will liaise with internal and external stakeholders across multiple functions. • In view of continuous product- & service improvement you will exchange customer feedback and market information with your colleagues. • You will monitor budget and timing targets, document your actions and provide regular updates and accurate progress reports. • You will report directly to the Director ITS Projects & Technical Support Services in Belgium.




Profile




Candidates for this role have a relevant and successful project & technical support management experience as Project-, Service- or Application Engineer, preferably in a multidisciplinary high-technological environment. • Ideally you are a qualified Project Manager (e.g. Prince2, PMI or similar) or you have the clear intention and motivation to get certified. • Experience in intelligent traffic solutions, security electronics, sensor technology or other smart and critical infrastructure definitely is a plus. • You have a proven hands-on experience with installations of servers and network equipment. • You are a customer focused and result driven professional with a strong sense of ownership and a high level of responsibility and commitment. • You are a well organized and autonomous self-starter with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines. • You are fluent in English and German (verbal & written) with knowledge of other European languages as an advantage. • You have a EU Passport and you live near or are willing to relocate to a larger metropolitan area in one of the countries where FLIR has its own offices (e.g. Germany, France, Belgium, Italy,The Netherlands). • Operating from your home-office you are prepared to travel regularly to customer sites for periods of approx. 2-3 days per trip.




Offer




FLIR offers a competitive salary with bonus and other benefits in an expanding, dynamic and stimulating international work environment with attractive growth and development opportunities.

 * Ausgezeichnetes Verständnis einer breiten Palette von Netzwerktechnologien, mit vertieften Kenntnissen in mindestens zwei technischen Bereichen
 * Expertise in mindestens zwei der folgenden technischen Bereiche: LAN und WAN für Unternehmen, Drahtlosnetzwerke
 * Erfahrung mit der Installation und Konfiguration von gängigen Betriebssystemen und Hardwareplattformen wie Microsoft Windows, MACOSX und UNIX/Linux
 * Starke Problemlösungsfähigkeiten und eine flexible „Can-Do“-Einstellung

 * Fähigkeit, über verschiedene Kulturen hinweg zu beeinflussen und effektiv zu arbeiten
 * Fähigkeit, mehrere Konten und Chancen gleichzeitig zu priorisieren und zu managen

title: Solutions Engineer (m/f/d)
description:
About Zeotap

Founded in Berlin in 2014, Zeotap started with a mission to provide high-quality data to marketers. As we evolved, we recognized a greater challenge: helping brands create personalized, multi-channel experiences in a world that demands strict data privacy and compliance. This drive led to the launch of Zeotap’s Customer Data Platform (CDP) in 2020—a powerful, AI-native SaaS suite built on Google Cloud that empowers brands to unlock and activate customer data securely.

Today, Zeotap is trusted by some of the world’s most innovative brands, including Virgin Media O2, Amazon, and Audi, to create engaging, data-driven customer experiences that drive better business outcomes across marketing, sales, and service. With an unique background in high-quality data solutions, Zeotap is a leader in the European CDP market, empowering enterprises with a secure, privacy-first solution to harness the full potential of their customer data.

The Role

As a pre-sales Solutions Engineer specialist (SE), you will be a part of an innovative group of Zeotap technologists that support Sales & Success organizations to develop and implement strategies to take their prospects and customers to a new level of performance and outcomes. Solutioning is fundamental to the role and will include assisting the customer, Account Executives, and Customer Success Managers with the discovery, analysis, and recommendation of strategic solutions across many different industries, verticals, and segments. These solutions will leverage Zeotap technologies to address the core advertising and marketing challenges and objectives that are uniquely identified for each customer.

A Zeotap SE works in a dynamic, fast growth environment where their expertise in design, business consulting, and technology is leveraged every day to drive customer success and ACV.

You will be aligned to a specific territory and/or region of Zeotap where you will closely collaborate with Sales and Success account teams and their leadership to execute growth strategies that result in customer success + revenue growth.

You will lead yourself and your teammates to properly prepare for any customer-facing engagement as well as work cross-functionally with stakeholders and corporate resources as needed to create and close the pipeline.

You will give and receive clear and honest feedback and flawlessly execute our sales processes to surpass your assigned ACV targets.

In this role you will report on all sales activity and forecast directly to the Head of Solutions Engineering.

Your Impact

This is an incredibly important role as you will directly impact the growth and trajectory of Zeotap. You will be masterful with internal and external engagements and put the customer in the center of everything you do. You will work closely and collaborate with the Zeotap ecosystem to inspire them to support you so you can exceed your assigned quota.

Responsibilities


 * Zeotap SE’s are leaders – they epitomize our 4 core values (Trustworthy, Adaptive, Pioneer & Challenger) while they map account strategies, align resources, and act as an extension of their customers. They partner with customers and collaborate with internal teammates to drive consensus on multi-product technology solutions across Zeotap’s product lines.
   
   
   

They work very closely with Sales & Success, product specialists, marketing, and executives to work on a wide array of assignments including business development, operations and IT strategies, as well as executive level product demonstrations to achieve the following:


 * Help define, manage, and execute the growth strategy and performance of a territory
 * Increase awareness of the entire suite of Zeotap solutions across all accounts of your assigned territory
 * Understand your customer’s business(es) and how it operates & the priorities that drive decisions
 * Create demand by discovering business problems or opportunities and aligning them to our solution(s.)
 * Build credibility and trust with necessary external stakeholders to influence buying decisions to drive credibility and trust in your territory
 * Take both ambiguous and complex business problems and using research and business assessment capabilities, define the problem, drive innovative ideas, define the opportunity set, and recommend actionable next steps
 * Bring rigor to a customer’s decision making process by evaluating and presenting solution options and in doing so, drive consensus among key stakeholders.
 * Collaborate with customers to develop new decision frameworks and governance processes that continue to deliver value beyond a particular engagement or bundle of solutions
 * Support the generation of pipeline that results in over-achievement of quota while exceeding CSAT scores
 * Collaborate with internal resources & external partners in order to drive additional value to the customer
 * Demonstrate through Zeotap software demonstrations and rapid prototyping how connected experiences come to life with Zeotap. This includes but is not limited to the delivery of executive level demonstrations, construction of future state customer journey strategies, and developing IT roadmaps
 * Accurately report and forecast activity to regional and executive leadership
 * Learn and distribute market intelligence to your team(s) and greater Zeotap ecosystem
 * Adhere to Zeotap’s company, privacy and information security policies and procedures.
 * Complete all the awareness trainings assigned on time
 * Become the trusted advisor of your territory.
   
   
   

Requirements


 * At least 3-5 years of field experience supporting sales functions either as a Solutions Engineer or Solutions Consultant, selling & solutioning digital advertising & marketing technologies like DMP, CDP, CMP, and/or CRM solutions, programmatic digital data products and comparable marketing or advertising SaaS solutions to every level of a marketing or advertising organization across a variety of industries and verticals.
 * You will also have a successful history of creating market opportunities and are comfortable selling & solutioning in a wide variety of arenas from the C-suite to industry events and have the ability to create, support, and/or deliver impactful presentations accordingly
 * Mandatory: Fluency in English and German, additional language would be a plus

description:

Job Description

Your crew during this flight:

We are a growing team in the Laboratory Testing department and are responsible for testing the various systems integration of our eVTOL vehicle in the laboratory environment.

Our mission is to ensure that systems’ functional and certification requirements are verified, and by strong interaction with system designers and developers, show that the systems are airworthy.

To ensure efficiency in the test execution you will support the development, installation, and operation of the laboratory as well as its integration with the aircraft systems.

 * It will be your duty to set up, configure and validate the test equipment before each test execution

 * 3+ years of working experience with Requirements Engineering
 * Knowledge of system schematics and wiring diagrams
 * Very good knowledge of the English language
 * Structured, independent, and solution-oriented way of working
 * Experience communicating effectively with internal and external stakeholders
   
   

Preferred skills:

title: RAMS Engineer
description:
Sécheron Hasler Group continues the Swiss tradition of over 140 years in the field of railway technology. We are a leading global supplier of electrical and electronic safety components and solutions and traction power systems for the railway industry and also provide solutions for renewable energy, DC grid, and other industrial systems. The name Sécheron Hasler

Group is worldwide synonymous with Swiss Quality and represents a leading reference for state-of-the-art products supplied to the market. With more than 1200 employees worldwide, we are wherever our customers are around the globe. We supply products approved in our customers' countries or markets and deliver top-notch supply chain and customer services locally.

You are responsible for implementing the activities related to Reliability, Availability, Maintainability, Safety (RAMS), and Life Cycle Costs (LCC). You will also be sporadically taking part in RAMS and safety training and courses.

The main tasks within this important and safety-relevant function are:


 * Analysis of electronic assemblies, creation of component models and implementation of reliability analyses
 * Contribution to the customer projects and product development projects as RAMS specialist
 * Coordination of activities in order to carry out Failure Mode and Effects Analysis (FMEA)
 * Checking customer-specific system configurations for compliance with the normative requirements for RAM/LCC
   
   
   

Requirements

As a Rams Engineer, you would have:


 * You have an electronics university degree (or similar), software knowledge is an advantage
 * You have very good communication and documentation skills in both French and English
 * You have at least three years of experience in RAMS/LCC in railway, automotive or aerospace industry
 * Basic knowledge of reliability prediction methods
 * Knowledge of EN 50126, EN 50128/EN 50657, EN 50129 is an advantage
 * Experience in a safety-related environment is an advantage
 * You are mentally flexible and thirsty for knowledge
 * You like to work autonomously as well as in a team and you want to pass on your specialized knowledge
 * You have the ability to identify and assess vulnerabilities, risks and opportunities
   
   
   

Benefits

What we offer:

We have flat hierarchies and encourage direct communication between departments and management levels. This allows us to make decisions quickly.

We give our employees full responsibility for their work tasks. We encourage all employees to take initiative and contribute to the operational excellence of the company, and we provide ample opportunities for them to achieve their personal and professional growth goals.

A valid work visa is required to apply for this position; unfortunately, we do not offer sponsorship.

How to apply:

Do you have a positive attitude and are you looking for a stimulating and rewarding work environment? If so, we look forward to receiving your application.

Sécheron Hasler Group is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and welcomes applications from all sectors of the community.

For more information, please visit our website: https://www.secheron.com/

Looking for other opportunities? Visit our job site: https://www.secheron.com/careers/

description:

WAS DU MITBRINGST

The Space System Engineer will be responsible for the design, development, and implementation of satellite avionics concepts using MA61C for testing, subsystem integration, such as the attitude and control system, and complete spacecraft integration. The person will be hired directly to support the development of the modular Attitude Determination and Control System (mADCS) project and the orbit control system. Furthermore, the engineer will create SPiN's in-house capabilities to support and implement AOCS solutions in small satellites.

 * Analysis and consolidation of mission requirements

 * Knowledge of the AIT process: manufacture, assembly, electrical, functional, and environmental tests
 * Experience developing system-level documentation, including ICDs, AIT plans, TPs/TRs, equipment lists, FMECAs, etc.
 * Experience with Matlab/Simulink or similar programming languages, along with basic knowledge of C/C++
 * Knowledge of MBSE tools is an advantage
 * Experience working with ESA is an advantage
 * Fluent in English

Working conditions

 * Location: Darmstadt, Germany
 * Start date: Q1 2025

We strongly believe in making payments seamless and invisible, linking them with value added services within the framework of a reliable identity service. Our mantra: #wesolvepayn. We are seeking experienced Site Reliability Engineers (m/f/d) to join our newly formed SRE team and help us ensure that our payment systems and tools are reliable, scalable, observable, and secure. The SRE will collaborate with product teams to design, implement, and maintain infrastructure, tooling, and processes that support our mission-critical payment applications and services. Ideally, you have a strong background in software- and infrastructure-engineering.

You will be facing the exciting challenge to build and establish SRE as a new paradigm at paymenttools. We are looking forward to getting to know you - so, even if you feel that you don’t quite meet all the requirements, but the position still excites you and you think you would love to work with us, please reach out! Your Tasks


 * You collaborate with and mentor product teams to establish reliability and production standards for their services.
 * You implement, automate and improve our services, infrastructure, tools, tasks and processes to improve efficiency and reduce errors/toil.
 * You identify, monitor, measure, and optimize important metrics to our systems.

 * You foster a culture of continuous learning from our incidents and how to avoid them in the future.
 * It is important for you to ensure compliance with security and regulatory requirements for our payment systems.
 * You drive projects End-to-End.
   
   

Your Experience

 * You are experienced with cloud and containers, we use GCP, Kubernetes

Our Benefits

 * REWE discount card for discounts for REWE group retailers
 * JobRad, affordable bicycle leasing!

Our Integration Expert is a key member of our IT Run Team responsible for maintaining the highest level of development and after support for key system integrations and processes. We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior 3GPP Architect with specialized expertise in protocol customization to join our dynamic team. As a Senior 3GPP Architect, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and optimizing telecommunications systems and protocols according to the latest 3GPP standards. Your primary responsibility will be to customize and tailor protocol specifications to meet the requirements of Rivada Space Systems Outernet.

This Includes


 * Leading the architecture and design of telecommunications systems based on 3GPP standards, ensuring compliance and interoperability
 * Customizing and extending existing protocol specifications to address specific project needs, incorporating new features and functionalities
 * Collaborating with cross-functional teams including software engineers, system architects, and product managers to define and implement protocol customization requirements
 * Conducting thorough analysis and evaluation of protocol performance, identifying areas for optimization and improvement
 * Staying updated on the latest advancements in 3GPP standards and telecommunications technologies, integrating relevant developments into our projects and solutions
 * Driving innovation and contributing to the development of new protocols, algorithms, and techniques to enhance the performance and capabilities of our telecommunications systems
   
   

What you bring on the table


 * Successfully completed a degree in Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related field
 * Extensive experience in telecommunications, with a focus on 3GPP standards and protocols :
    * Physical and MAC layer procedures
    * Channel structure: physical, transport and logical channels mapping
    * Signaling procedures: Random access, RRC connection setup, signaling radio bearers, system information block, master information block
    * Downlink and uplink transmission schemes
    * Registration management and access control
    * UE Identities: IMSI, IMEI, SUPI / SUCI, TMSI, RNTI

 * Proven expertise in protocol customization, including hands-on experience with modifying and extending protocol specifications
 * Strong understanding of wireless communication principles, including radio access networks (RAN), core network (CN), and protocols such as LTE, NR, and 5G
 * Familiar with software-defined networking (SDN) and network function virtualization (NFV) concepts
 * Proficiency in programming languages such as C/C++ and scripting languages like Python for protocol customization and implementatio
 * Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to troubleshoot complex issues and optimize protocol performance
 * Effective communication skills and demonstrated leadership experience
 * Experienced in waterfall and agile methodologies
 * Strong vendor and suppliers management
 * Familiar with software-defined networking (SDN) and network function virtualization (NFV) concepts
 * Excellent written and spoken English
   

Why you should join us

We are an international team of space enthusiasts, following one great vision. We value equality in our work environment where different opinions, backgrounds and experiences are not only welcomed but also necessary to achieve the best result collaboratively.

This permanent position was created recently and thus offers a lot of creative freedom. Our approach is to create a modern work environment with hybrid working model. We offer an attractive salary depending on your experience.

Rivada Space Networks is an equal opportunity employer with the approach to create a diverse and inclusive working environment. We therefore welcome applications from all qualified candidates irrespective of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, ethnicity, age, disability, or other individual characteristics.

About Us

Rivada Space Networks is deploying the first true “OuterNET™”: a global low latency point-to-point connectivity network of LEO satellites. By connecting our satellites with lasers, we will provide resellers and B2B customers with the ability to securely connect any two points on the globe with low latency and high bandwidth. The constellations, comprising 600 low-earth-orbit communications satellites, will represent a fundamental change in the availability of secure, global, end-to-end enterprise-grade connectivity for Telecom, Enterprise, Maritime, Energy and Government Services markets. Rivada Space Networks is a wholly owned subsidiary of Rivada Networks, Inc. 

Rivada is working with Terran Orbital to manufacture and SpaceX to launch our satellites. The deployment starts in 2025 with full-service launch in 2026.

Your crew during this flight:

As a systems engineer for mechanical systems, you will be part of a dynamic and driven team responsible for defining requirements, devising verification strategies, and conducting corresponding test campaigns. Your role will also involve ensuring that all equipment sourced from suppliers align with the specific needs and requirements of Volocopter.

Your mission during this flight:

The role of a system engineer involves overseeing the development, verification, and testing of the internally and externally developed mechanical elements of the aircraft, to ensure it meets all product and certification requirements. You will work closely with your team to optimize the system definition, requirements, and verification, taking into account key factors such as usability, maintenance, costs, and timelines.

You will be responsible for defining testing requirements for both development and verification phases. Ultimately, your efforts will play a vital role in ensuring that the mechanical elements meet stakeholders' expectations and perform to the highest aerospace standards.

You will work autonomously and provide guidance to the rest of the system engineering team as well as other interfaces that depend on the systems engineering process. You will define development and verification strategies, and have a high influence on the development of our mechanical systems.

Your responsibilities will be:


 * Generation and optimization of system engineering processes required to develop structures and mechanical components.
 * Definition, specification, and development assurance for mechanical elements.
 * Verification strategy definition - develop a plan for meeting the requirements, including certification plans and exchanges with the certification authority (e.g. EASA)
 * Structural testing definition and supervision: oversee the testing process to ensure compliance, and address any deviations or non-compliances.
 * Lifecycle management of supplier systems.
   
   

Qualifications

 * Mechanical or Aerospace Engineering degree (M.Sc., Ph.D.)
 * Minimum 5+ years of professional experience as a systems engineer in mechanical systems in aerospace industry.
 * Proven experience in aircraft development on lightweight composite structures and rotors.
 * Experience with supplier selection, evaluation, and management.
 * Experience with mechanical systems and/or structures certification.
 * Experience in certification according to aerospace standards.
 * A structured way of working and a high sense of accountability.
 * Experience with prototyping and testing.
 * Excellent communication skills with internal and external stakeholders.
   
   

Preferred skills:


 * 7+ years of experience as a systems engineer in mechanical systems in aerospace industry.
 * Hand-on, creative, pragmatic and solution-oriented way of working in cross functional teams.
 * Open-minded and willing to think outside the box.
 * Good understanding light structures and aircraft mechanical systems and certification process.
 * Technical project management experience.
 * Experience with aerospace standards: CS23, CS25, CS27, CS29, SC-VTOL.

title: Design and Test Engineer (f/m/d)
description:
Hi there! Thanks for stopping by 👋

Are you passionate about tackling climate change? Eager to make a real impact on the environment? Well, look no further - you're in the perfect place!

We're looking for a Design and Test Engineer to join our team in Offenburg. This is a hybrid position with typically 1-2 home office days per week (depending on actual work). You will work with our multidisciplinary team to design and test our ultra-high temperature electric heaters to decarbonize industrial furnaces.

What you'll be doing:

Within 1 month, you will:


 * Gain familiarity with your colleagues' roles.
 * Be introduced to our technology and participate in our development processes.
 * Familiarize yourself with our design standards and how they are applied.
 * Collaborate with a coworker to conduct initial tests with a prototype.
   
   

Within 3 months, you will:


 * Perform design tasks and the creation of technical drawings.
 * Engage with our suppliers or identify new ones to discuss our ideas.
 * Plan and construct a test setup autonomously.
   
   

Within 6 months, you will:


 * Develop our product further from concept through pre-liminary sizing and first designs to serial manufacturing independently and present them to your team for discussion.
 * Execute tests and ensure thorough documentation of the results.
 * Introduce fresh ideas that enhance our overall development efforts.
   
   

What you'll bring to the team:


 * Technician, Bachelor's or Master's degree in Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering or related field.
 * A strong technical understanding (function, manufacturability, assembly)
 * CAD experience (e.g., Inventor or similar software)
 * Full proficiency in German to communicate with our suppliers
 * Excellent written and spoken English to communicate with the team, our customers and our suppliers
   
   

Even better if you have:


 * Work experience, especially in high-temperature and ceramics design, testing and manufacturing
 * Self-driven and independent work attitude.
 * Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work effectively in a team environment.
 * Strong communication skills and ability to present technical information.
 * Please note this is a hybrid role requiring a minimum of at least 3 days per week on-site in Offenburg, Germany. **
   
   

We understand that there's more to a person than what's on their CV. If you're unsure whether you have the right profile for the role… go ahead and hit the 'Apply' button and give it a try!

What's in it for you?

Working at HyperHeat


 * We're a climate tech startup. You'll join us in our mission to fight climate change and make a real difference!
 * You'll learn all about our company, our story, our team, and our workflow, and you will receive comprehensive practical onboarding.
 * We're a small, close-knit crew that values teamwork, open chats, and a flat structure. You'll work closely directly with the founders.
 * We're all about growth and learning, so we keep feedback positive and helpful.
 * The team is led by supportive and approachable managers who recognize and reward your work.
 * You'll be part of a team that likes to work together, help each other, share insights and achieve success.
 * We value everyone's voice, with scheduled 1:1 and team calls to keep things running smoothly.
 * We speak English here, so everyone's on the same page and can communicate smoothly.
   
   

And some benefits to keep you happy:


 * Opportunity for rapid professional growth and hands-on experience in a climate startup environment.
 * Flexible working hours and remote work options tailored to your lifestyle.
 * 30 days of annual leave for optimal, well-charged batteries.
 * Annual Christmas dinner hosted by the founders.
 * Laptop and accessories provided based on your preferences.
 * Regular team-building activities.
 * Access to a mental health support program.
   
   

Who we are:

Hyperheat is a young Climate Tech start-up with experienced founders and the goal of developing a renewable heat solution for energy-intensive industries. Basic industrial products, such as steel, cement, chemicals, glass, and paper, form the material basis of modern societies. However, the heat demand for their production is responsible for around 20% of human CO2 emissions (or 7,5 Gt CO2 each year) due to burning fossil fuels — therefore, it is one of the last major sectors without attractive, sustainable decarbonization solutions yet.

Hyperheat's products will provide a complete temperature range of up to 2000°C, making it a replacement for almost every gas burner in the industry. Our solution will be more cost-effective than the fossil state of the art, contributing to a new basis for global prosperity. At the heart of the development is a durable and cost-effective electric heater that can provide industrial process heat 24/7 from PV and wind power when combined with thermal storage.

Hiring Process


 * Screening Interview with a team member (online call).
 * Job Interview with the hiring manager (online call).
 * Completion of a relevant take-home task to simulate actual work.
 * Homework Interview (online call).
 * Skill & Team interview with the team members (on-site at our office in Offenburg).
 * Reference check involving two provided references.
 * Decision.
   
   

At HyperHeat, we care deeply about inclusive working practices and diverse teams, so we particularly encourage applications from different under-represented demographics. If you'd prefer to work part-time or as a job-share, we'll facilitate this wherever we can – whether to help you meet other commitments or to help you strike a great work-life balance. You're encouraged to apply even if your experience doesn't precisely match the job description.

Note: We currently do not offer visa sponsorships, so you already need a valid work visa for the EU to apply.
